docs.snippet: Week Ended July 18, 1947 Business in the foreign exchange market last week passed over without significance so far as rate variations were concerned. Only a light business was reported.
docs.lead_paragraph: Week Ended July 18, 1947 Business in the foreign exchange market last week passed over without significance so far as rate variations were concerned. Only a light business was reported.

docs.snippet: LONDON, July 22 --The stock markets here today underwent a further contraction in business and closed generally lower.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 22 --The stock markets here today underwent a further contraction in business and closed generally lower.

headline.main: BONDS AND SHARES ON LONDON MARKET; Business Contracts Further and British Government Issues Lead Decline

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: NEWPORT, R.I., July 23 -- Mr. and Mrs. Richard Van Nest Gambrill of Vernon Manor, Peapack, N.J., and this city have made known the engagement of their daughter, Ann Van Nest, to James J. Casey of New York, son of Mrs. N. H. Casey of San Francisco.
docs.lead_paragraph: NEWPORT, R.I., July 23 -- Mr. and Mrs. Richard Van Nest Gambrill of Vernon Manor, Peapack, N.J., and this city have made known the engagement of their daughter, Ann Van Nest, to James J. Casey of New York, son of Mrs. N. H. Casey of San Francisco.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, July 24 -- The weakest spot in a generally dull stock market here today was Central Uruguay Railroad, which was marked down 1 1/2 -- speculators being disappointed with the amount of sterling to be released under the joint agreement.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 24 -- The weakest spot in a generally dull stock market here today was Central Uruguay Railroad, which was marked down 1 1/2 -- speculators being disappointed with the amount of sterling to be released under the joint agreement.

headline.main: BONDS AND SHARES ON LONDON MARKET; Weakness Is General in Dull Session, Central Uruguay Leading the Decline

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: will rept to Vatican on resettlement projects
docs.abstract: will rept to Vatican on resettlement projects

headline.main: VATICAN TO GET REPORT; Will Hear of Survey of DP's in South America I

docs.snippet: THE French Line's steamer De Grasse is back in luxury passenger service. The 18,435-ton liner, which on Tuesday completed Her first post-war voyage to New York, will maintain a monthly schedule between New York, Le Havre and Southampton.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE French Line's steamer De Grasse is back in luxury passenger service. The 18,435-ton liner, which on Tuesday completed Her first post-war voyage to New York, will maintain a monthly schedule between New York, Le Havre and Southampton.

headline.main: Freed and Refurbished, the De Grasse Is Back in the Atlantic Service

headline.main: U.S. CYCLISTS ELIMINATED; Lauf, Thompson, Stiller Put Out of Title Sprint in Paris

docs.snippet: Awards of twenty-nine fellowships to Latin Americans with stipends totaling $80,000 were announced yesterday by the John Simon Guggenheim Memorial Foundation.
docs.lead_paragraph: Awards of twenty-nine fellowships to Latin Americans with stipends totaling $80,000 were announced yesterday by the John Simon Guggenheim Memorial Foundation.
docs.abstract: Awards 29 fellowships to Latin Americans; recipients listed; advisory bd staff changes

headline.main: LATIN AMERICANS WIN FELLOWSHIPS; Guggenheim Fund Announces 29 Awards With Stipends Totaling $80,000

docs.snippet: Relaxation by the United States of the non-discrimination clause of the British loan agreement, which required Britain to accord American trade the same treatment as other areas, had a favorable effect on the market for sterling "forwards" last week.
docs.lead_paragraph: Relaxation by the United States of the non-discrimination clause of the British loan agreement, which required Britain to accord American trade the same treatment as other areas, had a favorable effect on the market for sterling "forwards" last week.
